title: Drunk airBaltic co-pilot jailed
text:
Save 
A co-pilot has been handed a six-month prison sentence after he failed a breathalyser test shortly before take-off. 
The 38-year-old man who was due to help fly an airBaltic jet from Oslo to Greece was found to be almost seven times over the legal limit. 
According to the AFP press agency he admitted drinking two bottles of whisky and some beer with crew members. 
The 50-year-old Latvian pilot, who was more than double the legal limit, has rejected some of the charges against him. 
Two of the Latvian flight attendants also scored positive tests for alcohol. 
The airline has started dismissal proceedings against the crew.
